Text: Samples of each (original files created and shrunken .m4a files) are also included so you can get a good sample of each.

With all respect Mr.Tsuris,
Neospeech Julie is better than Bridget, i tried them both.

Bridget sounds more human like but her rhythm and speed is not good like Julie.

But thanks very very much for uploading this AIO torrent, I wish people will seed this for a year.

No Mr. needed (am a guy but still young..i hope :P) Each will have their own opinion, i prefer the tone of Julie but bridget sounds more natural and that was what mattered to me (also in speak to file bridget goes about 2-5x as fast, again all a matter of preference).  As a question to all interested in scifi, i am looking to create a mass Isaac Asimov torrent, with actual voices (where available) and tts where not, does anyone else have a preference on the voice chosen?

Tsuris you are right, Bridget is excellent. Thank you for the torrent.

I remember before Vista/7 came out, there were going to be more voices than just Anna, I wonder what happened?

BTW, Freespace SCP can use these "speakers".
PS It's hard to believe, but AT&T has definitely been surpassed (to my ears) by the NeoSpeech options.

Hi and thank you for the torrent. 

And also, to people who are new to text-to-speach English voices, I recommend "Paul". It is by *far* superior to all other voices I've tried, and I've tried pretty much all of them. Trust me, I use TTS for years now. And as for software, I recommend "NaturalReader". Google it and you'll find it on torrent sites.

So to recap:

Best Voice: -Paul- [by NeoSpeech]

Best Software: -NaturalReader-
I really like julie's voice, but looks like it can't run on W7 64-bit T_T
